page.title: 16THE RIVER THAMES
page.content: The River Thames flows through the south west corner of this area,flowing east to west to the estuary near Southend. It is tidal here resulting in a mixture of salt and fresh water.There is much apparent birdlife and an increasing number of fish species reported as the river becomes less polluted _ Salmon have been taken out of the W.Thurrock Power Station water inlet. Large ships can still be seen on the river moving up to the Purfleet Deep Water Wharf and further upriver towards London.There are also many smaller vessels to be seen,such as tugs,barges,coasters and private yachts. The river is crossed here by the Dartford Tunnel.
